intro: Zornia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty zornia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Zornia pulchella is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and thrive in challenging environments.
